Finally, the Ford Foundation
had reconstituted itself as a nation¬

of the main concerns of its new pro¬

Adult Education to develop ways of
bringing new knowledge and cul¬

never again sit inside a classroom.
By establishing the Fund for the
Advancement of Education, and by
programs of its own, the Founda¬
tion sought not only to help meet
the educational crisis but to turn it
into an opportunity for improve¬
ments in the quality of education.
